You should hear me in a actual political debate in person.  Honestly I've been debating whether or not to join actual politics cause I'm one of those people that can walk right into a screamfest in real life between two people and five minutes later they'll be having brunch and discussing it over tea.

The problem people seem to have when debating is they have the idea of, "let me scream at you that I think you're wrong".
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Even if vaccines did cause autism, I would much rather be autistic* than have polio/smallpox/mumps/measles/rubella. 

*I actually have Asperger's, a mild form of autism. And no, it wasn't a self-diagnosis. I can't remember who diagnosed it but I believe it was a social worker or psychiatrist.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c11136368720dcfcb0200#post_538c11136368720dcfcb0200

One of my teachers said once _Debating politics is like discussing your family with someone else. The risk of insulting someone is always present, you will do your damn best to proof yours is better wether subtlety or openly, but by the end of the day, you still rather talk about them instead of spending time with them_

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c11136368720dcfcb0200#post_538c11136368720dcfcb0200
You I think would do a far better job than the vast majority of politicians at getting things done. Your political stance on things seems to be that of personal freedom and logic instead of bigotry, hatred, shortsightedness and stupidity so I would say go for it! You'd have my support.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c11fe6368720e35320300#post_538c11fe6368720e35320300
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538c11136368720dcfcb0200#post_538c11136368720dcfcb0200

One of my teachers said once _Debating politics is like discussing your family with someone else. The risk of insulting someone is always present, you will do your damn best to proof yours is better wether subtlety or openly, but by the end of the day, you still rather talk about them instead of spending time with them_[/bq]
Here's a personal belief of mine that forms a large basis of who I am, "It is the thought that we can never get along that causes us to never get along and that it is our own thoughts that there is a unbreakable barrier between us that causes the barriers between us".

If you stop thinking in the terms of, "Oh we're too different of people", "We can never get along", "It's impossible to coexist" and start recognizing that people aren't "just" <x> they are people in of themselves and that you're a person too it will massively change your life for the better.  To use a analogy stop thinking of people as solely their political identity, race, religion, sex, gender and so forth and realize they're just people also.

If you do so it makes understanding others and having others understand you in return much easier.  Too many people don't understand others for the simple reason of the belief you can't understand others.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
